snippet: The Commerce Department said that wholesale inventories edged up 0.1 percent, the smallest rise since July of last year, after a 0.2 percent gain in June.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports that wholesale inventories edged up 0.1 percent in July, smallest rise since July 2013, after 0.2 percent gain in June; figures suggest slower pace of accumulation of goods at start of third quarter and prompt economists to trim growth estimates.
lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department said that wholesale inventories edged up 0.1 percent, the smallest rise since July of last year, after a 0.2 percent gain in June.
